physDesc.p: The letter is 1 page long. It is typed on blank paper. The words “Little Review” are written in pencil at the top.

body.div:
December 7, 1914 My dearMiss Anderson:
I am very glad indeed you are going to take “The Allies,” as it is a poem to which I am attached. But indeed you are wrong about “The Footmen” – I consider it one of the best things I have done at all, although I can quite understand that it may not be popular.
You puzzle me a little by telling me that you longed to keep all the short poems, and then send them all back. Does that mean that you would really like them for a later number, or that you would like to use them and cannot?
I expect to be in Chicago the end of this week. As soon as I know definitely, I will wire you. I shall bring a number of poems under my arm, like a drummer, and you can choose from among them what you would like for some future issue. I wish I could tell you definitely now about my coming, but I am waiting for a wire from a friend of mine with whom I must connect and who is coming through from the West. Yours truly,
Miss Margaret Anderson, 917 Fine Arts Building, Chicago, Illinois.
